sentence.text: Drug Label for drug brand InderalLA, containing propranolol hydrochloride.

mmtx.phraseText: Drug Label for drug brand InderalLA,

sentence.text: Propranolol is contraindicated in 1) cardiogenic shock, 2) sinus bradycardia and greater than first-degree block, 3) bronchial asthma, and 4) in patients with known hypersensitivity to propranolol hydrochloride.

Although beta blockers should be avoided in overt congestive heart failure, some have been shown to be highly beneficial when used with close follow-up in patients with a history of failure who are well compensated and are receiving diuretics as needed.
Beta-adrenergic blocking agents do not abolish the inotropic action of digitalis on heart muscle.

Propranolol should be administered with caution in this setting since it may provoke a bronchial asthmatic attack by blocking bronchodilation produced by endogenous and exogenous catecholamine stimulation of beta-receptors.

Beta-adrenergic blockade may prevent the appearance of certain premonitory signs and symptoms (pulse rate and pressure changes) of acute hypoglycemia, especially in labile insulin-dependent diabetics.
Propranolol may change thyroid-function tests, increasing T4 and reverse T3, and decreasing T3.

While taking beta-blockers, patients with a history of severe anaphylactic reaction to a variety of allergens may be more reactive to repeated challenge, either accidental, diagnostic, or therapeutic.
In patients with hypertension, use of propranolol has been associated with elevated levels of serum potassium, serum transaminases, and alkaline phosphatase.

mmtx.phraseText: associated with elevated levels of serum potassium,

sentence.text: In severe heart failure, the use of propranolol has been associated with increases in Blood Urea Nitrogen.
Caution should be exercised when Inderal LA is administered with drugs that have an affect on CYP2D6, 1A2, or 2C19 metabolic pathways.

entity.text: drugs that have an affect on CYP2D6 metabolic pathways
drugs that have an affect on 2C19 metabolic pathways
drugs that have an affect on 1A2 metabolic pathways

sentence.text: Co-administration of such drugs with propranolol may lead to clinically relevant drug interactions and changes on its efficacy and/or toxicity (see Drug Interactions in PHARMACOKINETICS AND DRUG METABOLISM ).

antecedentSentence.Text: Caution should be exercised when Inderal LA is administered with drugs that have an affect on CYP2D6, 1A2, or 2C19 metabolic pathways.

sentence.text: Alcohol when used concomitantly with propranolol, may increase plasma levels of propranolol.
Propafenone has negative inotropic and beta-blocking properties that can be additive to those of propranolol.

entity.text: negative inotropic and beta-blocking properties that can be additive

sentence.text: Quinidine increases the concentration of propranolol and produces greater degrees of clinical beta-blockade and may cause postural hypotension.
Amiodarone is an antiarrhythmic agent with negative chronotropic properties that may be additive to those seen with -blockers such as propranolol.

entity.text: negative chronotropic properties that may be additive

mmtx.phraseText: an antiarrhythmic agent with negative chronotropic properties

sentence.text: The clearance of lidocaine is reduced with administration of propranolol.
Lidocaine toxicity has been reported following co-administration with propranolol.
Caution should be exercised when administering Inderal LA with drugs that slow A-V nodal conduction, e.g., lidocaine and calcium channel blockers.

entity.text: drugs that slow A-V nodal conduction

sentence.text: Both digitalis glycosides and beta-blockers slow atrioventricular conduction and decrease heart rate.
Concomitant use can increase the risk of bradycardia.

ellipsisSentence.text: Both digitalis glycosides and beta-blockers slow atrioventricular conduction and decrease heart rate.
Both digitalis glycosides and beta-blockers slow atrioventricular conduction and decrease heart rate.

sentence.text: Caution should be exercised when patients receiving a beta-blocker are administered a calcium-channel-blocking drug with negative inotropic and/or chronotropic effects.

entity.text: calcium-channel-blocking drug with negative inotropic and/or chronotropic effects

mmtx.phraseText: a calcium-channel-blocking drug with negative inotropic

sentence.text: There have been reports of significant bradycardia, heart failure, and cardiovascular collapse with concurrent use of verapamil and beta-blockers.

mmtx.phraseText: cardiovascular collapse with concurrent use of verapamil

sentence.text: Co-administration of propranolol and diltiazem in patients with cardiac disease has been associated with bradycardia, hypotension, high degree heart block, and heart failure.
When combined with beta-blockers, ACE inhibitors can cause hypotension, particularly in the setting of acute myocardial infarction.

mmtx.phraseText: particularly in the setting of acute myocardial infarction.

sentence.text: The antihypertensive effects of clonidine may be antagonized by beta-blockers.
Inderal LA should be administered cautiously to patients withdrawing from clonidine.
Prazosin has been associated with prolongation of first dose hypotension in the presence of beta-blockers.
Postural hypotension has been reported in patients taking both beta-blockers and terazosin or doxazosin.

Patients receiving catecholamine-depleting drugs, such as reserpine should be closely observed for excessive reduction of resting sympathetic nervous activity, which may result in hypotension, marked bradycardia, vertigo, syncopal attacks, or orthostatic hypotension.

entity.text: excessive reduction of resting sympathetic nervous activity

mmtx.phraseText: observed for excessive reduction of resting sympathetic nervous activity,

sentence.text: Patients on long-term therapy with propranolol may experience uncontrolled hypertension if administered epinephrine as a consequence of unopposed alpha-receptor stimulation.

mmtx.phraseText: administered epinephrine as a consequence of unopposed alpha-receptor stimulation.

sentence.text: Epinephrine is therefore not indicated in the treatment of propranolol overdose (see OVERDOSAGE ).

mmtx.phraseText: indicated in the treatment of propranolol overdose

sentence.text: Isoproterenol and Dobutamine
Propranolol is a competitive inhibitor of beta-receptor agonists, and its effects can be reversed by administration of such agents, e.g., dobutamine or isoproterenol.

mmtx.phraseText: a competitive inhibitor of beta-receptor agonists,
a competitive inhibitor of beta-receptor agonists,
a competitive inhibitor of beta-receptor agonists,
a competitive inhibitor of beta-receptor agonists,

sentence.text: Also, propranolol may reduce sensitivity to dobutamine stress echocardiography in patients undergoing evaluation for myocardial ischemia.
Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) have been reported to blunt the antihypertensive effect of beta-adrenoreceptor blocking agents.

mmtx.phraseText: the antihypertensive effect of beta-adrenoreceptor blocking agents.

sentence.text: Administration of indomethacin with propranolol may reduce the efficacy of propranolol in reducing blood pressure and heart rate.
The hypotensive effects of MAO inhibitors or tricyclic antidepressants may be exacerbated when administered with beta-blockers by interfering with the beta blocking activity of propranolol.

mmtx.phraseText: The hypotensive effects of MAO inhibitors
interfering with the beta blocking activity of propranolol.

sentence.text: Methoxyflurane and trichloroethylene may depress myocardial contractility when administered with propranolol.
Propranolol when administered with warfarin increases the concentration of warfarin.
Prothrombin time, therefore, should be monitored.

ellipsisSentence.text: Propranolol when administered with warfarin increases the concentration of warfarin.
Propranolol when administered with warfarin increases the concentration of warfarin.

sentence.text: Hypotension and cardiac arrest have been reported with the concomitant use of propranolol and haloperidol.

mmtx.phraseText: reported with the concomitant use of propranolol

sentence.text: Thyroxine may result in a lower than expected T3 concentration when used concomitantly with propranolol.
On a body surface area basis, this dose in the mouse and rat is, respectively, about equal to and about twice the maximum recommended human oral daily dose (MRHD) of 640 mg propranolol hydrochloride.

mmtx.phraseText: On a body surface area basis,
